definition: To bring someone back into a group or community, especially after a period of separation or exclusion. This term is commonly used in the context of social or professional settings, where individuals are reintegrated into a team, organization, or society after being disconnected or isolated.

examples.german: Die Schülerin wurde in die Klasse reintegriert.
examples.english: The student was reintegrated into the class.

examples.german: Es ist wichtig, ehemalige Straftäter in die Gesellschaft zu reintegrieren.
examples.english: It is important to reintegrate former criminals into society.

examples.german: Die Organisation arbeitet daran, Flüchtlinge in den Arbeitsmarkt zu reintegrieren.
examples.english: The organization is working on reintegrating refugees into the job market.

examples.german: Nach seiner Genesung wurde er wieder in das Team reintegriert.
examples.english: After his recovery, he was reintegrated into the team.
